intro: Vincetoxicum atratum, commonly known as black nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is characterized by its dark purple to black berries, which are toxic to humans and animals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has small, alternate leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces a distinctive, unpleasant odor. Vincetoxicum atratum is often found in woodland habitats across Europe and parts of Asia.
